verb.description: Originally: to make stark or strong, to strengthen. Now especially: to expose or emphasize the starkness of; to render severe or uncompromising; to delineate in sharp relief.
To become stiff; (of liquid) to coagulate, solidify. Also with object: to make stiff, thicken. Compare "stark". Now English regional and Irish English (northern).

origin: Late Middle English (in an earlier sense). From stark + -en.
